claim: For Codebase Community users who created more than 10 posts, the average user age is 34.083333333333336 years.
extra_info: creating more than 10 post refers to Count (UserId) > 10; average of the up votes = Divide (Sum(UpVotes), Count (UserId)); average age = Divide (Sum(Age), Count(UserId))
reasoning: For users who created more than 10 posts (COUNT(OwnerUserId) > 10 in the posts table), the average age computed as AVG(Age) = SUM(Age)/COUNT(non-null Age) = 10634/312 = 34.083333333333336, which exactly matches the claimed value.

content.content:
CREATE TABLE posts
(
    Id                    INTEGER          not null UNIQUE
        primary key,
    PostTypeId            INTEGER          null,
    AcceptedAnswerId      INTEGER          null,
    CreaionDate           DATETIME     null,
    Score                 INTEGER          null,
    ViewCount             INTEGER          null,
    Body                  TEXT     null,
    OwnerUserId           INTEGER          null,
    LasActivityDate       DATETIME     null,
    Title                 TEXT null,
    Tags                  TEXT null,
    AnswerCount           INTEGER          null,
    CommentCount          INTEGER          null,
    FavoriteCount         INTEGER          null,
    LastEditorUserId      INTEGER          null,
    LastEditDate          DATETIME     null,
    CommunityOwnedDate    DATETIME    null,
    ParentId              INTEGER          null,
    ClosedDate            DATETIME     null,
    OwnerDisplayName      TEXT null,
    LastEditorDisplayName TEXT null,
        foreign key (LastEditorUserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (OwnerUserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (ParentId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.text: Good. Now let me query to find users who created more than 10 posts and calculate their average age.

input.command:
sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/codebase_community.sqlite" "
SELECT 
    CAST(SUM(u.Age) AS REAL) / COUNT(u.Id) AS avg_age,
    COUNT(u.Id) AS num_users
FROM users u
WHERE u.Id IN (
    SELECT OwnerUserId 
    FROM posts 
    GROUP BY OwnerUserId 
    HAVING COUNT(OwnerUserId) > 10
);
"
input.description: Calculate average age of users with more than 10 posts

content.text: That gives a very different number. The hint says "average age = Divide(Sum(Age), Count(UserId))" — but some users may have NULL age. Let me check more carefully, including how NULLs affect this.

input.command:
sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/codebase_community.sqlite" "
SELECT 
    SUM(u.Age) AS sum_age,
    COUNT(u.Id) AS count_users,
    COUNT(u.Age) AS count_non_null_age,
    AVG(u.Age) AS avg_age_builtin
FROM users u
WHERE u.Id IN (
    SELECT OwnerUserId 
    FROM posts 
    GROUP BY OwnerUserId 
    HAVING COUNT(OwnerUserId) > 10
);
"
input.description: Detailed age statistics for users with more than 10 posts

content.text:
Interesting! So:
- Sum of ages = 10634
- Total users (including NULL age) = 1165
- Users with non-NULL age = 312
- AVG(Age) using SQL built-in (ignoring NULLs) = 34.0833333333333

The claim says the average user age is 34.083333333333336. The SQL AVG function (which divides sum by count of non-null values) gives 34.0833333333333, which is essentially 10634/312 = 34.08333333333333... (repeating).

Let me verify the exact value:

The exact calculation gives 34.083333333333336, which matches the claim exactly.

Now let me verify the interpretation: the hint says "average age = Divide(Sum(Age), Count(UserId))". But actually, using Count(UserId) as the denominator would give 10634/1165 = 9.128..., which doesn't match. The claim value matches when using COUNT of non-null Age values (312) as the denominator, which is what SQL's AVG() function does. The claimed value 34.083333333333336 = 10634/312.

Since the claim states the average is 34.083333333333336 and the standard AVG(Age) computation gives exactly that value, and this is the natural interpretation of "average user age" (average over users who have an age value), the claim is **ENTAILED**.

```json
{"label": "ENTAILED", "reasoning": "For users who created more than 10 posts (COUNT(OwnerUserId) > 10 in the posts table), the average age computed as AVG(Age) = SUM(Age)/COUNT(non-null Age) = 10634/312 = 34.083333333333336, which exactly matches the claimed value."}
```
